title: Latitude IPO repriced to $1.78; 11-times profit
text:
Latitude Financial Group's initial public offering has been repriced to $1.78 a share, representing 11-times profit and 5.8 per cent dividend yield.

It is understood the deal was repriced on Monday morning ahead of a bookbuild to raise the funds which is slated for Tuesday and Wednesday.

Latitude is the biggest IPO in Australia this year. It had been seeking to raise $1.24 billion, however the offer size is expected to be smaller at the new price.

The decision to reprice comes after Latitude's owners fixed the deal at $2 a share on Friday, from an earlier range of $2 to $2.25.

Latitude's bankers were in the market talking to funds across the weekend, before the owners decided to cut the price to $1.78 to try to ensure it gets away and then trades well in the after market.

The owners will retain a majority stake in the company on listing.
